processes.name: Create a Release Marker in Instana
processes.description: This will send Instana a release marker

edges.to: Send Instana a marker on start of deployment

edges.from: Send Instana a marker on start of deployment

offsets.name: Send Instana a marker on start of deployment

properties.scriptBody:
export timestamp=`date "+%s000"`
echo $timestamp

curl -k --location --request POST "https://instana1.tivlab.raleigh.ibm.com/api/releases" \
  --header "Authorization: apiToken 51AnDXh9Qxu2axKgQPbjcg" \
  --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data "{
	\"name\": \"${p:application.name}-${p:environment.name}-${p:snapshot.name}\",
	\"start\": $timestamp
}"

cachedAuthTokenRestriction.name: System Default
cachedAuthTokenRestriction.description: Used by default for any plugin steps without a specified token restriction

processes.name: Draft-Product
processes.description: This process will publish the APIs and Products in Draft Mode.  This will make the APIs in that Product visible on the Developer Portal for use by application developers.

edges.to: Publish Product and API in Draft Mode

edges.from: Publish Product and API in Draft Mode

offsets.name: Publish Product and API in Draft Mode

cachedAuthTokenRestriction.name: System Default
cachedAuthTokenRestriction.description: Used by default for any plugin steps without a specified token restriction

properties.scriptBody:
pwd && ls -al
echo 'apic.path is ${p:apic.path}'

#
# Publish Product and API in Draft Mode so developers can access APIs in Developer Portal
#
${p:apic.path} draft-products:create --server ${p:apic.server} --org ${p:apic.organization} jgraceivt-product_1.0.1.yaml
echo $?
echo "APIs have been published to Drafts"

cachedAuthTokenRestriction.name: System Default
cachedAuthTokenRestriction.description: Used by default for any plugin steps without a specified token restriction

properties.contents:
<server description="new server">
    <!-- Enable features -->
    <featureManager>
        <feature>webProfile-8.0</feature>
        <feature>localConnector-1.0</feature>
        <feature>javaMail-1.6</feature>
        <feature>monitor-1.0</feature>
    </featureManager>
    <!-- To access this server from a remote client add a host attribute to the following element, e.g. host="*" -->
    <httpEndpoint host="*" httpPort="9080" httpsPort="9444" id="defaultHttpEndpoint"/>
    <!-- Automatically expand WAR files and EAR files -->
    <applicationManager autoExpand="true"/>
    <applicationMonitor updateTrigger="mbean"/>
    <!-- <webApplication contextRoot="sumapp" id="sum-app" location="sumapp.war" name="sum-app"/> -->
</server>
